--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandy Panico <magicqua=
rtz@...> wrote:
>
> To rise up to an impossible challenge meant having to d=
o something extraordinary.  But deeds of extraordinary feats did not have t=
o be larger than life.  Hearing past phrases from Master Yoketron , Tucson =
rides the torrent of water as if flying through air, as wings double as fin=
s, guiding him masterfully toward the root of the problem.  Saberback.   He=
 was the one hindering his progress.  Once again he shifts from dragon to w=
arrior and draws his blade while still riding the wave of water like a skil=
led surfer, using the walls of the cavern like a surf board, gaining altitu=
de and ground on Saberback.  Yet he makes no attempt to strike him directly=
.  With his sword Tucson guides the water over the blade, in a sideways pos=
ition, guiding a torrent of water in Saberbacks direction, in an attempt to=
 throw him off long enough to rescue Optimus Prime.
> 
> " A storm can find=
 anyone, no matter how devious they may think they are.  Now, it's time tha=
t a few tables were turned.    LEO!   SURROUND RODIMUS AND DETAIN HIM!  BIG=
 CONVOY, I NEED YOU TO SECURE NIGHTLIGHT!   MAXIMALS, PREDACONS, OPERATION =
STORM, NOW!"
> 
> Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for =
things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.
